a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Who Americans spend their time with, by age
Measured in minutes per day, based on averages from surveys in the United States between 2009 and 2019.
Data source: American Time Use Survey (2009-2019) and Lindberg (2017)
Note: Relationships used to categorize people are not exhaustive. Additionally, time spent with multiple people can be counted more
than once (e.g., attending a party with friends and partner counts toward both "friends" and "partner").
